definition[0]: to make a liquid such as water or alcohol more pure by heating it so that it becomes a gas and then letting it cool. Drinks such as whisky are made this way
definition[1]: to remove a chemical substance from a plant, for example by heating or pressing it
definition[2]: to get the main ideas or facts from a much larger amount of information
example[1]: The notes I had brought back were waiting to be distilled into a book.
